intro: Koeleria delavignei, commonly known as the Delavigne's needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Koeleria delavignei is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
